title: mRemoteNG Uninstall issues - no uninstall.exe file (files remain in registry)
author: vheardFS
body_snippet:
Some of our users are able to completely uninstall mRemoteNG by simply going to Apps & Features > Uninstall. 
But we have a good bit of users at our organization that are trying to uninstall mRemoteNG and are unsuccessful. 

We tried methods on https://www.revouninstaller.com/preview-log/?pid=7570&pname=mRemoteNG#:~:text=Method%202%3A%20Uninstall%20mRemoteNG%20via,and%20Features%2FPrograms%20and%20Features.&text=Look%20for%20mRemoteNG%20in%20the,you%20can%20initiate%20the%20uninstallation and...

comments.snippet:
Please have a look at the "Manual Uninstall" section in the [README.md](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/blob/v1.77.3-dev/README.md), there you should have listed all artifacts that mRemoteNG leaves. 

Another way you may try is to upgrade mRemoteNG to a newer version and see if there the uninstall works properly.
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet: Oh and please note as you are stating that there are no Apps&Features entries you may have a "portable version" in front of you which does not have any uninstaller. What's the path where the executable resides?
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.
comments.author: robertpopa22
